intro: Azorella prismatoclada, commonly known as the cushion plant, is a perennial flowering plant native to the high Andes of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae and is characterized by its dense, low-growing rosette structure. The plant produces small, white to pink flowers during the summer months. Its leaves are thick and fleshy, adapted to retain water in the harsh, high-altitude environment. Azorella prismatoclada is well-known for its ability to survive extreme cold and strong winds, making it a hardy species in alpine ecosystems.
